{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06109v1", "title": "Fundamental Limits on Clock Precision from Spacetime Uncertainty in
  Quantum Collapse Models", "summary": "Models of spontaneous wavefunction collapse explain the quantum-to-classical
transition without invoking the von Neumann measurement postulate. Prominent
frameworks, such as the Di\'osi-Penrose (DP) and Continuous Spontaneous
Localization (CSL) models, propose a continuous, spontaneous measurement of the
mass density field of quantized matter. We show that this mechanism could link
both models - not just DP - to fundamental uncertainties in Newtonian gravity.
Despite their non-relativistic nature, these models suggest an induced
uncertainty in the flow of time due to fluctuations in the Newtonian potential.
We calculate the ultimate limit on time uncertainty and demonstrate that the
resulting clock-time uncertainty remains negligible for all contemporary
time-keeping devices, including atomic clocks.", "main_category": "quant-ph", "categories": "quant-ph", "published": "2025-04-08T14:55:50Z"}
